Description: CISA and the FBI warned that threat actors using Androxgh0st malware are building a botnet focused on cloud credential theft and using the stolen information to deliver additional malicious payloads.
Google releases security updates to fix CVE-2024-0519, the first Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild since the start of the year.
Citrix urged customers to immediately patch Netscaler ADC and Gateway appliances exposed online against CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549, two actively exploited zero-day vulnerabilities.
Kansas State University (K-State) announces it is managing a cybersecurity incident that has disrupted certain network systems.
The National Bank of Angola discloses to have suffered a cyber attack.
Reporters Without Borders (RSF) announces to have found traces of spyware resembling NSO group’s Pegasus surveillance tool on the phones of two journalists in Togo (Loïc Lawson and Anani Sossou).
Researchers from Netcraft discover an increased number of high-volume health product campaigns exploiting cheap top-level domains (TLDs), reaching up to 60% of a TLD’s daily domain registrations.
J.D. Gilmour files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access an employee’s email account.
Blockchain protocol Socket pauses some operations after a threat actor steals $3.3 million.

Author: Mint Sandstorm (a.k.a. PHOSPHORUS), subgroup of APT35 (a.k.a. Charming Kitten)
Target: High-profile individuals working on Middle Eastern affairs at universities and research organizations in Belgium, France, Gaza, Israel, the United Kingdom, and the United States
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover a new campaign from the Iranian-backed Mint Sandstom state hackers, targeting high-profile employees of research organizations and universities across Europe and the United States in spearphishing attacks pushing a new backdoor malware known as MediaPl.
Country: BE FR IL PS UK US

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: A DDoS attack claimed by the pro-Russian group NoName057(16), temporarily disrupts access to a number of government websites, following Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s visit to Davos.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Huntress reveal that ransomware actors are again using TeamViewer to gain initial access to organization endpoints and attempt to deploy encryptors based on the leaked LockBit ransomware builder.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Foxsemicon Integrated Technology, a subsidiary of Taiwanese electronics giant Foxconn, appears to have been targeted by the notorious LockBit ransomware group, which claims to have exfiltrated 5 Tb of data.
Clearview Resources, a Canadian energy producer, discloses details surrounding a cyberattack that incurred a financial setback of US$1.5 million for the company.
Researchers from Cyble uncover a new espionage campaign potentially targeting the Indian Air Force with the Go Stealer information-stealing malware.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Dawson James Securities files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access portions of the company’s computer network.
A new dataset named Naz.API contains 71 million email addresses from 1 billion credentials compiled using credential stuffing lists and data stolen by information-stealing malware.

Researchers from Cado Security discover a new campaign targeting vulnerable Docker services, deploying an XMRig miner and the 9hits viewer app on compromised hosts, allowing a dual monetization strategy.

Author: COLDRIVER (a.k.a UNC4057, Star Blizzard and Callisto)
Target: Ukraine, NATO countries, academic institutions and NGOs
Description: Researchers Google TAG (Threat Analysis Group) reveal that the COLDRIVER Russian-backed hacking group is pushing Spica, a previously unknown backdoor malware using payloads masquerading as a PDF decryption tool.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: CISA warns that CVE-2023-35082, a critical authentication bypass vulnerability in Ivanti's Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) and MobileIron Core device management software (patched in August 2023) is now under active exploitation.
Researchers from Jamf discover a series of pirated macOS applications modified to communicate to attacker infrastructure, and hosted on Chinese pirating websites.

Author: TA866
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint identify a new phishing email campaign from TA866 after a hiatus of nine months.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Trustwave warn of a "notable increase" in threat actor activity actively exploiting CVE-2023-46604, a now-patched flaw in Apache ActiveMQ to deliver the Godzilla web shell on compromised hosts.
Researchers from Trellix discover NS-STEALER, a new Java-based "sophisticated" information stealer that uses a Discord bot to exfiltrate sensitive data from compromised hosts.

Author: Mimo
Description: Researchers from AhnLab reveal the details of a threat actor dubbed Mimo, exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to install coinminer and the Mimus ransomware.
Attack: Multiple vulnerabilities (Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228, WSO2 CVE-2022-29464, Atlassian Confluence CVE-2022-26134, PaperCut CVE-2023–27350, Apache ActiveMQ CVE-2023-46604

Description: Threat actors stole about $7.5 million from the US Health Department, after accessing an HHS system that processes civilian grant payments.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware operation claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Denham, a denim brand in the Netherlands. Fey days later the company confirms the cyber attack.
Researchers from Morphisec discover a campaign delivering a new version of the Chae$ malware employing advanced code polymorphism to bypass antivirus detection.
Community Memorial Healthcare (CMH) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had accessed the company’s IT network.
Threat actors break into the medical records at Crace Medical Centre.
Security researchers at Blockfence uncover a scam responsible for creating more than 1,300 fraudulent crypto tokens since April 2023, swindling $32 million from 42,000 victims.
VMware confirms that CVE-2023-34048, a critical vCenter Server remote code execution vulnerability patched in October is now under active exploitation.

Author: UNC3886
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the UNC3886, a Chinese threat group, has been exploiting the CVE-2023-34048 critical vCenter Server vulnerability as a zero-day since at least late 2021.
Numerous Payoneer users in Argentina report waking up to find that their 2FA-protected accounts were hacked and funds stolen after receiving SMS OTP codes while they were sleeping.

Author: Midnight Blizzard a.k.a. Cozy Bear, APT29, and Nobelium
Description: Microsoft warns that some of its corporate email accounts were breached and data stolen by a Russian state-sponsored hacking group known as Midnight Blizzard.
Trezor issues a security alert after identifying a data breach due to unauthorized access to their third-party support ticketing portal.
Jason's Deli warns of a data breach in notifications sent to customers of its online platform stating that their personal data was exposed in credential stuffing attacks.
Veolia North America, a subsidiary of transnational conglomerate Veolia, discloses a ransomware attack that impacts systems part of its Municipal Water division and disrupts its bill payment systems.

Author: Parrot TDS
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that the Parrot TDS (Traffic Distribution System) is still very active and its operators continue to work on making their JavaScript injections harder to detect and remove.
Researchers from Phylum discover 'oscompatible', a malicious package uploaded to the npm registry deploying a trojanized version of AnyDesk on compromised Windows machines.

Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign delivering the ZLoader (a.k.a. Terdot, DELoader, or Silent Night) malware, nearly two years after the botnet's infrastructure was dismantled in April 2022.

Target: Passenger Rail Agency of South Africa (PRASA)
Description: South Africa's railway agency (PRASA) discloses that it lost some 30.6 million rand (US$1.6 million) after the transport network fell victim to a phishing scam.
Canterbury City Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Dover District Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Thanet District Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Clackamas Community College suffers a cybersecurity incident and is forced to cancel all classes.

Researchers from AhnLab identify multiple instances of the SmokeLoader malware distributed to Ukrainian government entities and companies, including the Department of Justice, public institutions, insurance companies, medical institutions, construction companies, and manufacturing companies.
Researchers from Kroll observe an increased use of the malicious “SYSTEMBC” tool to maintain access in a compromised network.
Above Lending files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access LoanPro’s IT network.
First Financial Security (FFS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was recently targeted in a ransomware attack.
Sirius Federal files a notice of data breach after discovering that files stored on the company’s IT network were subject to unauthorized access.
Columbus Regional Healthcare System (CRHS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers were able to remove personal information from the company’s computer network.
Ashford files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access and acquire information stored on the company’s IT network.

Author: Phobos
Description: Primary Health & Wellness Center provides a public notice of a ransomware incident.
In a phone message, a voice edited to sound like Biden urges voters in New Hampshire not to cast their ballots in Tuesday’s Democratic primary.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to East Valley Institute of Technology.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Pratt Institute.
A widespread Facebook phishing campaign leads unsuspecting users to a website that steals the Facebook credentials.

Author: Akira
Description: Finnish IT services and enterprise cloud hosting provider Tietoevry suffers an Akira ransomware attack impacting cloud hosting customers in one of its data centers in Sweden.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Sandwich chain Subway launches an investigation after the notorious LockBit ransomware group claims over the weekend that it hacked into the company’s systems and stole vast amounts of information.

Author: Threat actors from Russia
Description: Monobank, Ukraine’s largest mobile-only bank, is hit with a DDoS attack.
The Finham Park Multi Academy Trust suffers three ransomware attacks.
Researchers from Shadowserver are observing exploitation attempts for the CVE-2023-22527 remote code execution flaw vulnerability that affects outdated versions of Atlassian Confluence servers.

Target: macOS users in the crypto space in the US and Germany
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a campaign where users are using a stealthy method to deliver to macOS users cryptowallet-stealing malware, named Activator, through DNS records that hide malicious scripts.
Apple releases security updates to address CVE-2024-23222, a zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks that could impact iPhones, Macs, and Apple TVs.

Author: ScarCruft a.k.a. APT37, InkySquid, RedEyes, Ricochet Chollima, and Ruby Sleet
Target: Media organizations and high-profile experts in North Korean affairs
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One unveil a new campaign targeting media organizations and high-profile experts in North Korean affairs, orchestrated by the threat actor known as ScarCruft.

Author: 'WS'
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover malicious packages on the open-source Python Package Index (PyPI) repository (nigpal, figflix, telerer, seGMM, fbdebug, sGMM, myGens, NewGends, and TestLibs111) that deliver an information stealing malware called WhiteSnake Stealer on Windows systems.

Author: 9Near – Hacktivist
Target: Thai Public Health Ministry’s Immunization Centre.
Description: A threat actor named '9Near – Hacktivist' claims to leak 55 million records allegedly taken from the Thai Public Health Ministry’s Immunization Centre.

Author: Naraka'
Description: An individual known as Naraka lists a data dump for sale on breachforums.is, featuring one of Thailand's largest bookstores called Chula Book. The breach affects over 160,000 users.

The operators of the UFO Market on Telegram put on sale stolen data with 538,418 records featuring personal identifiable information (PII) of Thai individuals, encompassing details like citizens' ID card numbers.

Author: R1g
Description: A threat actor named R1g leaks the personal database of the Royal Thai Volunteers, containing 4.6 million of records with sensitive personal information such as names, citizen ID numbers, gender, birthdates, and addresses.

The operators of the UFO Market on Telegram put on sale a massive amount of data, specifically 3,149,330 records related to students, believed to have been illicitly obtained from the Basic Education Commission (OBEC).

Target: Department of Older Persons in Thailand (DOP.go.th)
Description: The personal identifiable information (PII) primarily of elderly population in Thailand is leaked in a forum, with 690MB in size, containing 19,718,687 rows of data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Bangkok Industrial Gas Company Limited suffers a leak.

Author: Ghostr
Description: A threat actor named Ghostr leaks about 186GB of data with 5.3 million records from a stock trading platform.

Author: Milw0rm
Target: Unknown Job Seeking Platform in Thailand
Description: A threat actor named Milw0rm leaks 61,000 rows of records related to Thai job seekers and includes an extensive range of personal information.

Author: R1g
Description: The threat actor named R1g leaks sensitive information pertaining to Thailand Navy Officers.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Soni
Description: A threat actor named Soni posts a leaked database related to healthcare. The data breach consists of 25.5k records of user information including ID, user URL, encrypted passwords (phpass), user emails, login details, account status, display names, registration dates, and user activation keys.

Target: Officials and law enforcement personnel in Thailand
Description: Threat actors leak the personal identity details of officials and law enforcement personnel in Thailand, along with sensitive content.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A highly targeted phishing campaign named “My Slice” targets e-mail account holders of Italian organizations.
A thret actor with the nickname ‘roshtosh' leaks data from teenpatti.com, a gambling platform in India.
The same threat actor ‘roshtosh' leaks data from mpl.live (Mobile Premier League) another gambling platform in India.

Author: Play
Description: The Douglas County Libraries is hit with a Play ransomware attack.

Author: Threat actor from Pakistan
Description: Researchers from Cyfirma identify a campaign carried out by a Pakistan-based trheat actor, targeting Indians with fake loan Android applications.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: Multiple organizations in the healthcare sector
Description: The Department of Health and Human Services' Health Sector Cybersecurity Coordination Center (HHS HC3) warns of attacks on healthcare sector firms that use ConnectWise's remote access tool ScreenConnect.
Carnegie Mellon University informs about 7,300 people that their personal information may have been compromised in an August cyber attack.

Author: Kasseika
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal the details of 'Kasseika', a recently uncovered ransomware operation that employs Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) tactics to disable antivirus software before encrypting files.

Author: 'emo'
Description: A threat actor with the moniker of 'emo' leaks the private emails of 15,115,516 Trello members, using an exposed Trello API to link private email addresses with Trello accounts, enabling the creation of millions of data profiles containing both public and private information.

Author: VexTrio'
Description: Researchers from Infoblox reveal the details of 'VexTrio', a previously unknown traffic distribution system (TDS), active since at least 2017, aiding 60 affiliates in their cybercrime operations through a massive network of 70,000 sites.

Researchers from ReversingLabs discover warbeast2000 and kodiak2k, two malicious npm packages leveraging GitHub to store Base64-encrypted SSH keys stolen from developer systems on which they were installed.
Researchers from Arctic Wolf discover a new Go-based malware loader called CherryLoader, used to deliver additional payloads onto compromised hosts for follow-on exploitation.

Author: Mustang Panda (a.k.a. BASIN, Bronze President, Camaro Dragon, Earth Preta, HoneyMyte, RedDelta, Red Lich, Stately Taurus, and TEMP.Hex)
Target: Myanmar's Ministry of Defence and Foreign Affairs
Description: Researchers from CSIRT-CTI reveal the details of two campaigns from the China-based threat actor known as Mustang Panda, targeting Myanmar's Ministry of Defence and Foreign Affairs as part of twin campaigns designed to deploy backdoors and remote access trojans.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Frivinho
Description: Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed Frivinho.

Author: Slug'
Description: Aircraft leasing giant AerCap confirms falling victim to ransomware after 'Slug', an emerging cybercrime gang claimed responsibility for the attack.

Author: Black Basta
Description: Southern Water confirms to have been hit with a Black Basta ransomware attack. The ransomware group claims to have stolen 750 Gb of files.
The National Investor, an Abu Dhabi-based investment management and advisory firm, warns that its name and logo are being used to advertise fraudulent investment opportunities.
Khaadi, a clothing retail site based in Pakistan and the United Arab Emirates is hit with a magecart attack.
Researchers from Blockaid discover a phishing attack where an attacker was able to leverage a vulnerability in email service provider Mailer Lite to impersonate web3 companies, draining $600k+

Author: (BO Team) Pro-Ukrainian hacktivists
Target: Russian Center for Space Hydrometeorology, aka "Planeta" (планета)
Description: The Main Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine's Ministry of Defense claims that pro-Ukrainian hacktivists breached the Russian Center for Space Hydrometeorology, aka "Planeta" (планета), and wiped 2 petabytes of data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: New York-based global financial technology firm EquiLend says its operations have been disrupted after some systems were taken offline in a cyberattack. The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: 'Blackwood' (threat actor from China)
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of a previously unknown advanced threat actor tracked as 'Blackwood', using a sophisticated malware called NSPX30 in cyberespionage attacks against companies and individuals.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Kansas City Area Transportation Authority (KCATA) announces it was targeted by a ransomware attack. The Medusa ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Midnight Blizzard a.k.a. Cozy Bear, APT29, and Nobelium
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) discloses that suspected Russian hackers known as Midnight Blizzard gained access to the company's Microsoft Office 365 email environment to steal data from its cybersecurity team and other departments.

Author: Stone Panda (a.k.a. APT10, Bronze Riverside, Cicada, Earth Tengshe, MirrorFace, and Potassium)
Description: Researchers from Itochu discover an updated version of a backdoor called LODEINFO, distributed via spear-phishing attacks, and used against targets in Japan from the Chinese threat actor APT10.

Researchers from Blackberry reveal that Mexican financial institutions are under the radar of a new spear-phishing campaign that delivers a modified version of an open-source remote access trojan called AllaKore RAT.
The UK's Caravan and Motorhome Club (CAMC) faces a suspected cyberattack with members reporting widespread IT outages for the past five days.
Bucks County, Pennsylvania is hit with a cybersecurity incident that knocks out the Emergency Communications’ Department’s computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Another community in Pennsylvania — Washington County — also reports a cybersecurity incident. The county’s court system says it is “currently experiencing network outages.”
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Individuals seeking asylum in the United States
Description: Researchers from Cyble identify an ongoing campaign targeting individuals seeking asylum in the United States through the use of MetaStealer malware.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing the AsyncRAT (VenomRAT) disguised as a Korean company’s certificate, via malicious Office documents.
Sigrist, Cheek, Potter & Huyser (SCP&H) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to the company’s email system and cloud-based storage site.
Des Moines Orthopaedic Surgeons (DMOS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access the company’s computer network.

Researchers from Wordfence detect malicious activity targeting a critical severity flaw (CVE-2023-6933) in the ‘Better Search Replace’ WordPress plugin, with thousands of attempts in the past 24 hours.

Author: Midnight Blizzard a.k.a. Cozy Bear, APT29, and Nobelium
Description: Microsoft reveals that the Russian state-sponsored threat actor Midnight Blizzard, responsible for a cyber attack on its systems in late November 2023, has been targeting other organizations and that it's currently beginning to notify them.
Attack: >1 (Password Spray, Account takeover via malicious OAuth applications)

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal that Chinese-speaking users have been targeted by malicious Google ads for restricted messaging apps like Telegram as part of an ongoing malvertising campaign.

Author: FAUST
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the Phobos ransomware dubbed FAUST
Naftogaz, Ukraine's state-owned gas and oil company, is hit by a large-scale cyberattack.
Ukraine's state railway, Ukrzaliznytsia, confirms that some of its services are under attack, preventing some customers from buying tickets online
Ukrposhta, the Ukrainian postal service, is also it with a cyber attack.

Author: National Cyber Army
Description: Ukrtransbezpeka, an Ukrainian government agency providing transport and traffic security is hit with a cyber attack claimed by a Russian group known as the National Cyber Army.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: MeshSec
Description: Turkish hacktivists from MeshSec project political messages about the war in Gaza onto digital signage in an Israeli movie theater.
GC Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was the target of a recent cyberattack.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Planet Home Lending files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was recently the target of a ransomware attack.
Keenan & Associates sends notices of a data breach to 1.5 million customers, warning that threat actors accessed their personal information in a recent cyberattack.

Author: Albabat a.k.a. White Bat
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new ransomware family, written in Rust, dubbed Albabat.
The GALA Hispanic Theatre, a popular theater in Washington, D.C. has more than $250,000 in stolen funds returned after hackers managed to siphon the money out of their bank account.
Washington National Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that a senior officer was targeted in a SIM-swapping attack.
The Colombia office of US Aid Office, the U.S. government agency that oversees foreign aid and development funding says its Facebook page was hacked.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Somesing, a blockchain-based social karaoke platform in South Korea, suffers an exploit and loses 730 million of its native token SSX, which amounts to $11.58 million

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors are actively exploiting CVE-2024-23897 and CVE-2024-23898, two critical vulnerabilities affecting Jenkins.

Author: DHC
Description: Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed NOOSE.
The Freehold Township School District informs its staff, families, and students that its schools and offices would be closed due to a cybersecurity incident.

The FBI issues a warning, following a surge of reports regarding criminals using couriers to collect cash or precious metals like gold or silver from victims (many senior citizens) whom the scammers instructed to sell their valuables.

Author: Cactus
Description: Schneider Electric suffers a Cactus ransomware attack in the company's Sustainability Business division, leading to the theft of corporate data.

Author: DHC
Description: Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed DHC.
Researchers from Aqua Security discover an updated version of the malware HeadCrab, known to target Redis database servers across the world since early September 2021.
Fulton County discloses to have experienced a “widespread system outage”  during the weekend. A ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Asia-Pacific Network Information Centre (APNIC) African Network Information Centre (AFRINIC) Latin America and Caribbean Network Information Center (LACNIC)
Description: Researchers from Resecurity discover over 1,572 compromised credentials from customers of RIPE, Asia-Pacific Network Information Centre (APNIC), the African Network Information Centre (AFRINIC), and the Latin America and Caribbean Network Information Center (LACNIC), resulting from infostealer infections.

Author: Yahoo Boys and other threat actors from Nigeria
Description: The Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) reveals that teenagers from Western English-speaking countries are increasingly targeted by financial sextortion attacks conducted by Nigeria-based cybercriminals.

Author: Alpha
Target: Multiple industries from electrical, retail, biochemical, apparel, health, and real estate
Description: Researchers from Netenrich discover a new ransomware group called Alpha, recently emerging with the launch of its leak site on the Dark Web, featuring an initial listing of data from six victims.

Target: Ukraine Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War
Description: The Ukrainian state agency overseeing the treatment of prisoners says that it had restored access to its website after being hit by a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack over the weekend.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: OpenAI officials say that the ChatGPT histories a user reported result from his ChatGPT account being compromised.
The local region of Basilicata in Italy suffers a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Akira
Description: Researchers from Truesec’s uncover an Akira ransomware campaign exploiting an old Cisco ASA and FTD bug tracked as CVE-2020-3259.
The municipality of Teo in Spain, is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from  AT&T Cybersecurity discover a new phishing campaign abusing Microsoft Teams group chat requests to push malicious attachments that install the DarkGate malware payloads on victims' systems.

Author: UNC4990
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal the details of UNC4990, a financially motivated threat actor using USB devices for initial infection, and abusing legitimate online platforms, including GitHub, GitLab, Vimeo, and Ars Technica, to host encoded payloads embedded in seemingly benign content.

Author: CYBO CREW and UNIT8200
Description: Researchers from CloudSEK discover a massive database containing the information of roughly 750 million mobile subscribers in India offered for sale on the dark web.

Threat actors breach the database of the Romanian Chamber of Deputies, the lower house of the Parliament, reportedly managing to obtain confidential information, such as the prime minister’s identity documents, medical analyses, and other personal data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Global Affairs Canada suffers a cyber attack and says an "unplanned IT outage" is affecting remote access to its network, activated intentionally to "address the discovery of malicious cyber activity."
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from K7 Security Labs discover a new ransomware variant written in Python.

Author: TA576
Target: Accounting and finance organizations in the U.S.
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint identify the return of TA576, a cybercriminal threat actor that uses tax-themed lures specifically targeting accounting and finance organizations, in the attempt to deliver remote access trojans (RATs).

Author: Trigona
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new activity of the Trigona ransomware threat actor installing Mimic ransomware.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Saint Anthony Hospital files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to gain access to the organization’s IT network. The LockBit ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
Krystal BioTech (Krystal) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information that had been entrusted to the company.
Vail-Summit Orthopaedics & Neurosurgery (VSON) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party attempted to infiltrate the company’s computer network.
Bankers Life and Casualty Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access personal information that had been entrusted to the company.
Ivanti warns of CVE-2024-21893, a vulnerability impacting Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA gateways, under active exploitation.
CISA warns that CVE-2022-48618, a patched kernel security flaw affecting Apple iPhones, Macs, TVs, and watches is now being actively exploited in attacks.

Author: FBI
Description: The FBI disrupts the KV-botnet used by Chinese Volt Typhoon state hackers to evade detection during attacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure.

Author: UAC-0027
Description: The Computer Emergency Response Team in Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns about a PurpleFox (a.k.a. 'DirtyMoe') malware campaign that has infected at least 2,000 computers in the country.

Author: Pawn Storm (a.k.a. APT28 and Forest Blizzard)
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Russian state-sponsored actors from Pawn Storm have staged NT LAN Manager (NTLM) v2 hash relay attacks through various methods from April 2022 to November 2023, targeting high-value targets worldwide.
Threat actors steal around $112 million worth of the Ripple-focused cryptocurrency XRP from a crypto wallet belonging to the Ripple’s co-founder and executive chairman Chris Larsen.

Author: Rhysida
Description: Lurie Children’s Hospital suffers a network outage, later confirmed to be a ransomware attack by the Rhysida group demanding a $3.4M ransom.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a large-scale campaign called ApateWeb that uses a network of over 130,000 domains to deliver scareware, potentially unwanted programs (PUPs) and other scam pages.
Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal the details of a Nitrogen campaign hosting their payloads on compromised WordPress sites, many of which are already hacked with malicious PHP shell scripts.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: The IntelBroker group claims responsibility for a potential cyberattack on a popular (undisclosed) mobile banking app boasting over 10 million users. The threat actor posts details of the exploit on a hacker forum. Nu Bank might be the undisclosed target of the cyberattack.
Crescent Community Health Center (CCHC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that information that had been provided to the company was subject to unauthorized access.
Encore Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to gain access to an employee’s email account.
Emmanuel College files a notice of data breach after discovering that a cybersecurity incident affected the personal information of nearly 90k individuals.

Target: National Board of Osteopathic Medical Examiners
Description: The National Board of Osteopathic Medical Examiners (NBOME) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the organization’s IT network.
